references:
Massive MIMO is a key technology for next generation wireless networks since high data rate can be achieved when large antenna arrays are adopted [32]. Hence, we consider an FL based wireless communication system that consists of a BS equipped with a massive MIMO system of N𝑁N antennas serving K𝐾K arbitrarily distributed single-antenna users with N≫Kmuch-greater-than𝑁𝐾N\gg K as shown in Fig. 1. A given time interval is partitioned into L𝐿L frames with duration Toutsubscript𝑇outT_{\textrm{out}}. Each user k𝑘k has its dataset 𝒟k={𝑿k,𝒚k}subscript𝒟𝑘subscript𝑿𝑘subscript𝒚𝑘\mathcal{D}_{k}=\{\bm{X}_{k},\bm{y}_{k}\}, where 𝑿k=[𝒙k,1,𝒙k,2,…,𝒙k,Mk]subscript𝑿𝑘subscript𝒙𝑘1subscript𝒙𝑘2…subscript𝒙𝑘subscript𝑀𝑘\bm{X}_{k}=[\bm{x}_{k,1},\bm{x}_{k,2},\ldots,\bm{x}_{k,M_{k}}], and 𝒚k=[yk,1,yk,2,…,yk,Mk]subscript𝒚𝑘subscript𝑦𝑘1subscript𝑦𝑘2…subscript𝑦𝑘subscript𝑀𝑘\bm{y}_{k}=[y_{k,1},y_{k,2},\ldots,y_{k,M_{k}}] represent the input and output of user k𝑘k, Mksubscript𝑀𝑘M_{k} represents the number of the samples collected by user k𝑘k. Let M=∑k=1KMk𝑀superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾subscript𝑀𝑘M=\sum_{k=1}^{K}M_{k} be the total number of training data samples and 𝒘k​(i)subscript𝒘𝑘𝑖\bm{w}_{k}(i) be the weight vector of the local FL model of user k𝑘k at frame i𝑖i. The BS aims to fit the weight vector of the local FL model so as to minimize a particular loss function by using the whole dataset from all the available users. Hence, the global loss function can be expressed as 1K​∑k=1K∑m=1Mkf​(𝒘k​(i),𝒙k,m,yk,m)1𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑘1𝐾superscriptsubscript𝑚1subscript𝑀𝑘𝑓subscript𝒘𝑘𝑖subscript𝒙𝑘𝑚subscript𝑦𝑘𝑚\frac{1}{K}\sum_{k=1}^{K}\sum_{m=1}^{M_{k}}f(\bm{w}_{k}(i),\bm{x}_{k,m},{y}_{k,m}),
where f​(𝒘k​(i),𝒙k,m,yk)𝑓subscript𝒘𝑘𝑖subscript𝒙𝑘𝑚subscript𝑦𝑘f(\bm{w}_{k}(i),\bm{x}_{k,m},{y}_{k}) represents the loss function associated with data point 𝒙k,msubscript𝒙𝑘𝑚\bm{x}_{k,m}. The important notations are summarized in Table I.

S6.T2.caption: TABLE II: Simulation Parameters.
S6.T2.table:
Symbol Description Value
ν𝜈\nu path loss exponent 3.7
Bmaxsubscript𝐵maxB_{\textrm{max}} max battery capacity 50 J
N𝑁N number of antennas 128
K𝐾K number of users 10
L𝐿L number of frames 300
noise PSD -174 dBm/Hz
circuit power per RF chain 30 dBm
cell radius 500 m
references: In this section, the performance of the FL over a wireless system powered by energy harvesting is evaluated through experimental simulations. The users are assumed to be randomly distributed within a circular cell. Two scenarios are investigated for the simulations, single BS (scenario 1) and multiple BSs (scenario 2). The simulation parameters used in this section are summarized in Table II.
